modules.name: Quick Start
modules.longDescription: Fast-track onboarding guide that gets you productive with the AI assistant system in 15 minutes. Covers essential workflows, commands, and best practices.
modules.whenToUse: First thing to read when setting up the system in a new project.

modules.name: Decision Tree
modules.description: Visual guide for choosing the right workflow
modules.longDescription: Decision tree for selecting the appropriate workflow based on task complexity, risk level, and time requirements. Helps avoid over-engineering simple tasks.
modules.whenToUse: When starting any new task to determine the right approach.

modules.name: Quick Fix Protocol
modules.description: Level 1 workflow for quick fixes (<30 min)
modules.longDescription: Streamlined protocol for quick fixes that take less than 30 minutes and affect 1-2 files. Minimal overhead for low-risk changes like typos, config updates, and simple bug fixes.
modules.whenToUse: For typos, formatting, config changes, and obvious bug fixes that are low-risk.

modules.name: Atomic Task Protocol
modules.longDescription: Protocol for medium-complexity tasks that take 30 minutes to 3 hours. Uses TDD methodology, affects 2-10 files, and includes proper testing and documentation.
modules.whenToUse: For bug fixes, small features, new endpoints, and focused refactoring work.

modules.name: Phase 1 Planning
modules.longDescription: First phase of Level 3 feature workflow focused on planning. Produces PDR (Product Definition Report), technical analysis, and task breakdown before implementation.
modules.whenToUse: For complex, multi-day features that need architecture review and planning.

modules.name: Phase 2 Implementation
modules.longDescription: Second phase of Level 3 workflow focused on implementation. Guides TDD development, agent coordination, and incremental progress tracking.
modules.whenToUse: After Phase 1 planning is approved. Guides the actual implementation work.

modules.name: Phase 3 Validation
modules.longDescription: Third phase of Level 3 workflow focused on validation. Covers quality assurance, code review, security review, and acceptance testing.
modules.whenToUse: After implementation is complete. Ensures quality before finalization.

modules.name: Phase 4 Finalization
modules.longDescription: Final phase of Level 3 workflow covering documentation updates, changelog, commit preparation, and feature closure procedures.
modules.whenToUse: After validation passes. Wraps up the feature with proper documentation.

modules.name: Code Standards
modules.longDescription: Comprehensive coding standards for TypeScript projects covering naming conventions, file structure, type safety, error handling, and best practices.
modules.whenToUse: Reference when writing code. Ensures consistency across the project.

modules.name: Testing Standards
modules.longDescription: Testing standards including file organization, naming conventions, coverage requirements, and TDD practices. Ensures consistent test quality.
modules.whenToUse: Reference when writing tests. Ensures consistent testing approach.

modules.name: Documentation Standards
modules.longDescription: Standards for project documentation including README structure, API docs, inline comments, and markdown formatting guidelines.
modules.whenToUse: When writing or updating documentation. Ensures documentation consistency.

modules.name: Architecture Patterns
modules.longDescription: Architectural patterns for the project including layer structure, dependency injection, repository pattern, and service layer organization.
modules.whenToUse: When designing new features or modules. Ensures architectural consistency.

modules.name: Design Standards
modules.description: UI/UX design standards and accessibility guidelines
modules.longDescription: Standards for UI/UX design including CSS framework usage, component library guidelines, accessibility requirements (WCAG), and dark mode support.
modules.whenToUse: When building or reviewing UI components. Ensures design consistency and accessibility.

modules.name: Security Standards
modules.description: Security best practices and authentication patterns
modules.longDescription: Security standards covering authentication patterns (JWT, OAuth), input validation, CSRF protection, rate limiting, and secure coding practices.
modules.whenToUse: When implementing authentication, authorization, or handling user input.

modules.name: Performance Standards
modules.longDescription: Performance standards including Core Web Vitals targets (LCP, FID, CLS), bundle size limits, API response time requirements, and optimization best practices.
modules.whenToUse: When optimizing performance or reviewing code for performance impact.

modules.name: PDR Template
modules.longDescription: Template for creating Product Definition Reports (PDR) that capture user requirements, acceptance criteria, user stories, and functional specifications.
modules.whenToUse: When starting Phase 1 planning. Filled by Product Functional agent.

modules.name: Tech Analysis Template
modules.longDescription: Template for technical analysis documents that translate PDR into architecture design, database schemas, API contracts, and implementation approach.
modules.whenToUse: After PDR is complete. Filled by Product Technical agent.

modules.name: TODOs Template
modules.longDescription: Template for task breakdown documents that list all implementation tasks with estimates, dependencies, and assignment to agents.
modules.whenToUse: After tech analysis. Created by Product Technical, used for tracking.

modules.name: Workflow Diagrams
modules.longDescription: Collection of Mermaid diagrams visualizing workflows, agent hierarchy, tool relationships, and documentation structure for quick reference.
modules.whenToUse: When needing visual overview of the system or explaining it to others.

modules.name: Glossary
modules.longDescription: Comprehensive glossary of project-specific terms, abbreviations, and concepts. Ensures consistent terminology across documentation and communication.
modules.whenToUse: Reference when encountering unfamiliar terms or when writing documentation.

modules.name: MCP Servers
modules.longDescription: Documentation for configuring and using MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers including available servers, configuration options, and usage examples.
modules.whenToUse: When setting up or troubleshooting MCP server integrations.
